subject: Photography
title: Shutter Speed Basics
description: A quick, practical guide to Shutter Speed Basics.

hook.text: The shutter is a curtain in front of the sensor. How long it stays open decides if motion freezes or blurs.

buildup.text: Shutter speed is measured in fractions of a second. 1/1000 freezes a hummingbird. 1/30 blurs a walking person.

discovery.text: Faster shutter speeds freeze motion but need more light. Slower speeds blur motion but capture more light.

twist.text: Sometimes blur is intentional. Waterfalls go silky at slow speeds. Panning blurs backgrounds while subjects stay sharp.

climax.text: Shutter speed isn't just exposure control ‚Äî it's a creative tool that shapes how time appears in your image.

punchline.text: Shutter speed doesn't freeze time. It chooses how much to show.
